thread.title: Malcolm Turnbull calls Bill Shorten a fake in new attack - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Malcolm Turnbull calls Bill Shorten a fake in new attack - Yahoo7

author: News On February
title: Malcolm Turnbull calls Bill Shorten a fake in new attack - Yahoo7
text:
Share Malcolm Turnbull calls Bill Shorten a fake in new attack - Yahoo7 Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has continued his rampage against Opposition leader Bill Shorten calling him a "fake" who "doesn't have a fair dinkum bone in him” in his latest attack. Close 'He's a fake...he doesn't have a fair dinkum bone in him' UP NEXT VIDEO PM continues his attack on "sycophant" Bill Shorten. Source: ABC/Fairfax 'He's a fake...he doesn't have a fair dinkum bone in him' 
It follows Wednesday’s outburst by Mr Turnbull during parliament's question time, and the Labor Party leader's response when he said he did “feel” for the PM. 
“Shorten is a complete hypocrite,” a resolute and unapologetic Turnbull told reporters on Thursday. 
“I mean he wants to play the politics of envy and yet he’s been a sycophant to the billionaires of Melbourne for years and years,” a defiant Turnbull continued. Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has doubled down on his character assassination of Opposition Leader Bill Shorten. Source: 7 News Shorten has spoken out since the attack yesterday. Source: 7 News The Prime Minister did not hold back in his response dubbing Bill Shorten a "parasite". Photo: AAP. Close Shorten 'feels' for PM after war of words UP NEXT VIDEO Shorten 'feels' for PM after war of words. Source: 7 News Shorten 'feels' for PM after war of words 
“Everyone knows that, everyone knows that. 
“As I said yesterday there’s no union leader who’s tucked his knees under more billionaires' tables than Bill Shorten, and those criticisms rang true. 
“And the people who know him best are his own colleagues. 
“They know he is a fake, he has no integrity, no consistency, he doesn’t have a fair dinkum bone in him,” the PM said, ending his scathing attack on Shorten. I like angry Turnbull,I really really do https://t.co/cGmJ5iJtRK — Vanessa Viktoriya (@MsViktoriyaa) February 8, 2017 It's probably not winning many votes, but I love it when angry Turnbull is back 👌: https://t.co/qDCs0FhWeU — Troy J Coleman (@TroyJColeman) February 8, 2017 Turnbull unleashed on Labor leader Bill Shorten in response to claims he was attacking families, standards of living and being too tough on pensioners and soft on banks. Photo: AAP. The gloves were off for Malcolm Turnbull during Wednesday's Question Time. Photo: AAP. Earlier Shorten had hit back following Turnbull’s initial tirade against him, after he was labelled as a “social climbing sycophant” and “parasite” by the nations leader on Wednesday.
An angered Shorten had spoken out about the blasting he received stating, “I have a mortgage, I live in Moonee Ponds, I’m proud of it.” 
“Mr Turnbull was clearly fired up, but that’s about saving his job,” Shorten continued. 
“I feel a little bit for Malcolm at the moment, he’s under great pressure.” Close Turnbull, Shorten trade insults over welfare changes UP NEXT VIDEO Bill Shorten has hit back at the Prime Minister saying the vicious tirade against him, was Malcolm Turnbull "trying to save his own job". Source: 7 News Turnbull, Shorten trade insults over welfare changes Turnbull's heated response resulted in cheers and applause from Liberal benches. Photo: AAP. 
Yesterday’s initial and extraordinary attack by the usually measured Prime Minister occurred during Question Time when Shorten was accused of “sucking up to millionaires” and being in the pocket of Melbourne’s elite. 
The debate got partially heated over the Government’s proposed social welfare reforms. 
“There was never a union leader in Melbourne that tucked his knees under more billionaires' tables than the Leader of the Opposition,” Turnbull declared to cheers from the Liberal benches. 
Turnbull dubbed Shorten a “social climbing sycophant” who yearned for his own harbour-side mansion. 
The tirade came after the Labor leader accused the Prime Minister of being out of touch and unfit for the role. 
Shorten accused Turnbull of attacking families, attacking standards of living, of being tough on pensioners and soft on banks. Close 'He's a parasite': Turnbull rips into Shorten in parliament UP NEXT VIDEO Prime Minister Malcolm Turnbull has ripped into Opposition leader Bill Shorten in parliament, not holding back at all. Source: Parliament of Australia 'He's a parasite': Turnbull rips into Shorten in parliament Opposition Leader Bill Shorten during Wednesday's Question Time. Photo: AAP Australia's Deputy Prime Minister Barnaby Joyce's reaction said it all, as the fury erupted during Question Time on February 8. Photo: AAP 
He also slammed the Prime Minister as the “most out-of-touch personality to every hold the great office of Prime Minister.” 
Turnbull didn’t pull any punches with his reply, which saw members of the Coalition cheering and applauding. 
“This bloke has no consistency or integrity. He cannot be believed,” Turnbull said of Shorten during Question Time. 
Turnbull joked “most” of the Labor Party “have never done a day's work in their life”. 
He also claimed Shorten craved a life of “luxury at the expense of the Australian taxpayer”. 
“This man is a parasite.” Close News break - February 9 UP NEXT VIDEO Customers 'outraged' after power cut during heat wave Turnbull, Shorten trade insults over welfare changes, and more... News break - February 9
